title: (39670) Puente Viesgo - 45 Diseminado Puente Viesgo
description:
Tarmac parking area. Level. By the river, with crossing point to other bank to walk to the prehistoric caves (if the river is low). Quiet, locals walking dogs in the morning but not unhappy with us being parked. Good quality long distance cycle path next to parking spot so plenty of runners, walkers and cyclists. 

Sign in Spanish saying "please take your rubbish away", but nothing prohibiting camping.

Access: only the most northerly of the two roads named Bo. Corrobarceno on Google maps is actually accessible - OK in a 6m peugeot boxer panel van conversion, there is a narrow section with two protruding boulders about 20m off the main road which might be a bit narrow in a coach built motorhome (we probably had 20-30cm on each side in a Boxer panel van). The other two apparent roads on Google maps are blocked.

title: (39679) Vargas - 1094 Barrio Vargas
description: Self-service laundry. Modern machines, clothes come out clean and smell good. Are there any alternatives. Easy parking at the Dia supermarket opposite.

title: (39680) Ontaneda - 137B Barrio Ontaneda
description: ONTANEDA (Ayuntamiento of San Vicente de Toranzo). Address: Calle de Javier de Riancho. New area for campers. Bituminous soil, flat. 30 locations. This area is very recent. An automatic barrier device is in place. The access card can now be purchased from a machine in the middle of the motorhome park. The card reader is the digital keypad at the gate. Just place your card on the keypad and the gate opens.The car park is equipped with 9 electrical terminals each consisting of 4 power outlets. 36 in total. In the center of the area there is a service equipment for Wc cassettes and wastewater. Drinking water tap and tap to rinse the cassettes. At the edge of the area a greenway is present. Small flat: the width between the pillars supporting the barriers is only 3.14 meters. Municipal swimming pool nearby.

At night you can hear the traffic of the motorway and from 08:00 the planes brush against the skylights because the airport is next to it, but in general it is a quiet place.

title: (39130) Pedreña - 110A Barrio el Rostro

title: (39130) Pedreña - 137 Barrio Pedreña

title: (39313) Rinconeda - 15M Barrio Rinconeda

title: (39002) Santander - 1 Plaza Estaciones
description: It's the car park of the central station, so right in the city center. the entrance hight is 5.5m maximum as even trucks fit through... there is a CAR wash but no other services. The toilet is 1 minute away in the building of the central station. The car park has security guides at the entrance.

title: (39312) Polanco - 7J Barrio Requejada
description: Full laundry with washing and drying machines of three different sizes and large capacity as well as washer and dryer for pet clothes. Very clean and with a parking lot next to it where you can leave the motorhome while you are doing laundry, next to a small shady garden where you can be with your dog. Very close to the highway. Comfort and cleanliness.

title: (39300) Torrelavega - 4 Calle José Posada Herrera
description: Launderette self-service. Parking a little further at the Centro commercial. Opening hours 9am-10pm. . 12 and 15 kg. dryer available.

title: (39300) Torrelavega - 10 Calle Cid
description: Located right next to the covered children's playground. Two taps, no possibility to connect a hose. Parking around.

title: (39130) Cantabria - 1139 Barrio Pedreña

title: (39300) Barreda - 373 Avenida Solvay
description: Self-service laundry with 12 and 15 kilo machines and 16 kilo dryers. Change machine for 5 and 10 euro bills. And with ample parking

title: (39300) Torrelavega - 41 Paseo Niño
description: Parking 5 minutes from the center. shops

title: (39120) - CA-305

title: (39120) - 422 Barrio Liencres

title: (39120) Liencres - CA-305
description: Large asphalt parking lot surrounded by a huge forest. Day  without problems. There are taps with drinking water but no thread. There is a path to walk through the forest. Quiet and beautiful place to rest.

title: (39685) Vega de Pas - 8 CA-263
description: Very large car park, with BUS and passenger car spaces, signposted and free, next to a school and the clinic. It has a nice park with swings. The town is very close 100m. Usually very quiet even being very close to the road. Garbage and recycling. A fountain in the park (Bowling).

title: (39300) Torrelavega - 2 Calle Río Miera
description: Parking recently created by the city of torrelavega. No services. Far from the city center (20 minutes on foot). Torrelavega is a very festive town and it can get very crowded. This car park is a good fallback solution if the others are full. Calm. You can go there with a large motorhome. Indeed, it is possible to overflow on a grass part.

title: (39311) Cartes - 78A Calle Camino Real
description: Safe and quiet free parking. Ideal for parking with a motorhome, camper, etc. Next to a soccer field and a skatepark.

title: (39350) Suances - Barrio Hinojedo-Muelle
description: Small van place. You can ride a small 2x4 along a track a few meters to the Besaya greenway car park. Quiet, flat place without services. I recommend riding the bike to Suances by the estuary (7km)

title: (39311) Cartes - 74A Calle Camino Real
description: Parking day and night in the center of Cartes, a charming town. It is next to a large park with tables and children's games, also a sports area with paddle tennis, soccer and basketball courts. It also contains a green path that goes from Corrales de Buelna to Suances, ideal for cycling through all the towns in the area.

title: (39300) Torrelavega - 120 Paseo de Julio Hauzeur
description: Shaded parking next to the river and a park and a skateboarding area.

title: (39140) Somo - 19 Calle Peñas Blancas
description:
Ground parking at the entrance to Somo next to the estuary. Perfect for overnight, with garbage containers. Quiet place, the police passed and said nothing, we were 
about 10 vans and caravans. Bars around. 5 minutes walk from the beach.

Recently changed to paid parking, 5.50 euros for the whole day (10am-8pm)

title: (39120) Liencres - 14 CA-231

title_short: (39400) Los Corrales de Buelna - 0 Calle San Fernando
description: Parking of the town's sports center, located on the outskirts. There is a picnic area with shades. Although there were some young people at the picnic area, they left early and we parked far away. Very quiet night.

title: (39120) Liencres - CA-305
description:
Large car park on the beach renowned for surfing. A sign says that it is forbidden to spend the night, a lot of cars during the day but calm in the evening.

parked up evening of 21st June, big carpark, plenty of room in the evening, campers in for a few days parked over towards left as you enter. if you're a surfer you'll love it, safe for the average swimmer, if not a surfer or swimmer you still have to love it.

title: (39300) Torres - 21 Barrio el Milagro
description: Recreational area in the natural park of Las Cuencas. Tables, shade and a good place to eat and rest by the river.

address.street: 56 Avenida Playa San Juan de la Canal

title: (39140) Somo - 8A Calle Peñas Blancas
description: Public toilets, clean, free, in the middle of Somo, all the parking around is a blue zone.

name: Camping Somo Parque Cantabria
title: (39150) Camping Somo Parque Cantabria
description: Camping Somo Parque Cantabria. Small campsite with the essentials. Electricity, free hot showers. Clean bathrooms, with toilet paper. Small pitches, fairly level. Grey/Black water runoff. Restaurant at the entrance of the facilities. There are quite a few stationary caravans, probably from campers who have been in season for years. It has bungalows and mobile homes. They don't take reservations. It has no shop/supermarket. Next to the restaurant is a swimming pool that appears to be private. Supermarket 2 minutes drive away.

title: (39006) Santander - 67 Calle Fernando de los Ríos
title_short: (39006) Santander - 67 Calle Fernando de los Ríos
description: Laundry washes and dries your laundry. 10 minutes walk from the motorhome area of Santander. Washing machine 5 euros. Dryer from 3 to 6 euros depending on the weather.

title: (39300) Torrelavega - 102 Barrio Ganzo
description: It is a parking lot of a small shopping center that is very quiet and spacious. In the back there is no one and it overlooks an open space where it is very good. Perfect for stopping to stock up on EVERYTHING you may need. Ideal if you are on your way to other beaches. It is not to take the instagram photo but there is nature if you know how to see it.

title: (39006) Santander - 73 Calle Blas Cabrera
description: Laundry 10 minutes from the motorhome area with two washing machines for 12 kg of laundry and one for 15 kg. Two dryers of 15 kg each and a machine to change and have coins to use in the machines. Next to the laundromat there is a café-bar where you can have a drink while waiting. From 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

title: (39140) Somo - 16 Calle Ría Cubas
description: No parking on the road, 5 minutes from the ferry terminal for the ferry to Santander, 5 minutes from the beach, 3 minutes from the city, no service.

name: Motorhomes Area Suesa
title: (39160) Motorhomes Area Suesa
description: The best thing is the extent of the plots and with very good access. It is adjacent to the campsite and belongs to the same owners. Wifi, simple sanitary facilities, large loading and unloading area... The price is in line with the rest of the areas. There is electricity only in the first plots. It's a long walk to Somo Beach, but worth it. To improve I would say that it is for the attention of the owner, of which it must be said that it was correct but without excess.

title: (39150) - 8 Calle Calabazas
description: Small and shaded parking. We had dinner and breakfast there with a table and chairs outside. And sleep very peacefully, but ... it is next to a cemetery

title: (39140) Somo - 1 Avenida Trasmiera
description: Automatic laundromat. 3 washing machines 8/12 / 15kg and 3 dryers 16kg.

title: (39150) Suesa - 26 Diseminado Suesa
description: Recreation area on the outskirts of the town of Suesa, next to a farm. Green area with four picnic months and plenty of shade. Also, it has a few swings, litter bins, and a large grassy area.

title: (39140) Somo - 49A Barrio Somo
description: Place to park for the day and sleep, there are no people bothering you, you do not have to pay as in the whole town. Nice place, 5 min walk from the beach.

title: (39140) Somo - 10 Barrio Huyo
description: Large free access car park without height bar. Parking meter off. Free parking. 5 min walk from the beach. Superb sunset.

title: (39140) Somo - 33G Calle Cabo Mayor
description: It is a street that you can park and sleep quietly, but only Park not camping, I Park two nights and without problems, is full of ac and all vans parked and not camping, if you respect that without problems, have the beach side and beach showers and services. Recommended site. Best regards.

title: (39110) - 37I Barrio Soto M
description: Parking zone of future construction. Very close to cliffs Costa Quebrada. There is no prohibition sign.

title: (39012) Santander - 79 Calle La Cuevona
description: Parking very close to the main car park for the playa de la virgen del mar and the beautiful little church. very quiet and away from the confusion. Also close to nice trails. Advised!

title: (39140) - 11A Barrio Pinar de Arna
description: Large, hilly and grassy parking near the beach. During the busy day during the night, however, almost empty. Had a night without problems.

title_short: (39110) Santa Cruz de Bezana - 71H Avenida Playa San Juan de la Canal

You have to be lucky because not many possibilities for a motorhome. Attention, camper reception area at the entrance of the village.
